results.title: A Spoonful of sugar
results.brief_description: The network of cane farms and sugar mills in the valleys along the Queensland coast, which is the basis of the Australian sugar industry. The film shows something of the life of the cane cutters, and concludes with a demonstration of the whole process of extracting and refining sugar for the table.

results.title: A Spider builds his web = Netzbau dev kreuzspinne
results.brief_description: An example of a German teaching film designed for use at University level. Detailed close-up views of the methods used by the spider show his technique of “spot welding” individual strands of the web. Various experiments on destruction of the web show the repair work undertaken by the spider. The film concludes with views of the spider eating the web he has so carefully constructed. Silent film with German subtitles.

results.title: A Special place
results.creator_credit: Bill Pettigrew, Bill Brind and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: An absorbing, eye-opening view of Canada’s National Parks, illustrated by the activities of the parks staff - naturalists, geologists, park wardens and others who ensure that these special places remain that way. Mountain rescue, avalanche control, health services to animals, information service to visitors, restocking fishing waters - these and many other responsibilities occupy the National Parks officers. It is a view of the Canadian wilderness that encourages understanding and confidence.

results.title: A Song to remember
results.creator_credit: Charles Vidor, Louis F. Edelman and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Cornel Wilde is the tragic composer Chopin and Merle Oberon plays the radical feminist writer George Sands. ‘A Song to remember’ tells the story of this great pianist, fighting for the freedom of his beloved Poland and inspired by two beautiful women - one who loved him selflessly; the other who was cruel and aloof. Chopin’s life and genius was cut short in the full flower of his musical greatness. ‘A Song to remember’ is a sentimental costume drama and features the skilled playing of Jose Iturbi. This film was nominated for seven Academy Awards and also stars Paul Muni as Chopin’s mentor and nina Foch.

results.title: A Song of Ceylon
results.brief_description: This film refers not only to Basil Wright’s classic British documentary “The Song of Ceylon” but also to a name erased from the map of the world, for there is no country officially named Ceylon. Invoking this idea of absence the above film pursues a certain phantasy of the body, a somewhat abstract form of the body in extremis, the body in travail, the body in torsion. The extremity in question is around forms of hysteria. A Song of Ceylon explores the narcissistic body, the masochistic body, the hysterical body and maybe a few other bodies in extremis. This is done by bringing together two different theatrical traditions from two different cultures through the mediation of cinematography.

results.title: A Song of air
results.brief_description: An autobiographical account of a daughter’s relationship with her father from the interior of a “typical” Australian family of the 1950’s. Using original 16mm home movie footage filmed by her father, she speaks by means of voice-over of his severe religious and patriarchal oppression, and her resistance to his values and expectations.
